title: NF: AnnexRepo.call_annex*()
body:
Analog to GitRepo.call_git*() and a requirement for #5152 

Issues touched upon:

- Fixes #4406 
- Further towards #5003
- f3d28e8 changes error behavior in line with the proposal in #5048
- Fixes #5161 
- Fixes #5167
- Fixed #5169
- Fixes #5172


TODO

- [x] check that tests pass, mostly adjust for new behavior to raise whenever a command fails, and not hide errors in results #5048 
- [x] adjust `drop` command (and maybe helpers) to anticipate command error when calling `AnnexRepo.drop()`. ATM @mih thinks that calling `AnnexRepo._call_annex_records(['drop'])` is cleaner than going through the various hoops that `AnnexRepo.drop()` implies.
- [x] crosscheck with #4406
- [x] complete docstrings
- [x] investigate removal of `_annex_custom_command()` -> https://github.com/datalad/datalad-crawler/issues/84
- [x] remove `_annex_custom_command()`
- [x] re the removal of `_run_*annex_command*()` I can only see a single use outside -core:
    ```
    ./ukbiobank/datalad_ukbiobank/update.py:            for rec in repo._run_annex_command_json('drop', **drop_kwargs):
    ```
   for @mih it is OK to rip out immediately (i.e. keep the respective commits in this PR, and fix ukbiobank in parallel)
- [x] discuss a public partner API for `_call_annex_records()`
- [x] return mechanism for records delivered before command failure. Right now they end up in `CommandError.kwargs['stdout_json']`
- [x]  discuss which post-error recovery/annotation functionality to shift from `_call_annex_records()` into `_call_annex()`
- [x] should we anticipate a future generator capability of the `Runner` and make `call_annex_records()` a `call_annex_records_()` right away?
